qas.question: When did Comcast acquire the cable assets of AT&T Broadband?
What did Comcast pay for this subsidiary?
What was the original name of AT&T Broadband and Comcast going to be?
When Comcast purchased AT&T Broadband, how many customers did they service?
Comcast's advertising and commercial production branch was called what?
How many customers did AT&T Broadband bring to Comcast?
What was Comcast Spotlight renamed as?
What year was Comcast Advertising Sales renamed?
What city is Comcast Spotlight located in?
How much did AT&T purchase Comcast for?

context: In <a0_0><b7_0>2001<b7_0/><a0_0/>, Comcast announced it would acquire the assets of the largest cable television operator at the time, AT&T Broadband, for <b9_0>US<a1_0>$44.5 billion<b9_0/><a1_0/>. The proposed name for the merged company was "<a2_0>AT&T Comcast<a2_0/>", but the companies ultimately decided to keep only the Comcast name. In 2002, Comcast acquired all assets of AT&T Broadband, thus making Comcast the largest cable television company in the United States with over <a3_0><b5_0>22 million<b5_0/><a3_0/> subscribers. This also spurred the start of <b6_0>Comcast Advertising Sales<b6_0/> (using AT&T's groundwork) which would later be renamed <a4_0>Comcast Spotlight<a4_0/>. As part of this acquisition, Comcast also acquired the National Digital Television Center in <b8_0>Centennial, Colorado<b8_0/> as a wholly owned subsidiary, which is today known as the Comcast Media Center.
